questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia. While Sydney is the largest city, Canberra was chosen as the capital in 1908 as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is the longest river in the world at approximately 6,650 km (4,130 miles), flowing through northeastern Africa.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who invented the telephone?
questions.explanation: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876. He was awarded the first U.S. patent for the invention of the telephone.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: When did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945. Germany surrendered on May 8, 1945 (V-E Day), and Japan surrendered on September 2, 1945 (V-J Day).

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Where is the headquarters of the United Nations located?
questions.explanation: The United Nations headquarters is located in New York City, USA. It was established there in 1952.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which country has the largest population in the world?
questions.explanation: As of 2023, India has surpassed China to become the world's most populous country with over 1.4 billion people.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who wrote the famous play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet around 1594-1596. It is one of his most famous tragedies.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who is known as the father of computers?
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage is known as the father of computers. He designed the Analytical Engine in the 1830s, which had the basic elements of a modern computer.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world with an area of approximately 0.44 square kilometers (0.17 square miles).

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: In which year did Pakistan gain independence?
questions.explanation: Pakistan gained independence on August 14, 1947, when British India was partitioned into two independent dominions: India and Pakistan.
